title: Gauff overcomes Keys in 3 to reach French semis
content: Coco Gauff overcame 10 double faults and the first set she has dropped this year at the French Open to beat Madison Keys 6-7 (6), 6-4, 6-1 and reach the semifinals for the third time.

content: The Knicks have fired coach Tom Thibodeau just a week after he led the team to its first Eastern Conference finals in 25 years.

title: More men allege sexual misconduct by ex-IU doc
content: At least 15 former Indiana men's basketball players are alleging improper sexual conduct by a former team physician and saying Indiana officials, including the late coach Bobby Knight, were aware of the behavior.

content: UFC flyweight Maycee Barber told ESPN on Tuesday that a medical complication in her locker room during warmups Saturday led to the last-minute cancellation of her UFC Fight Night bout against Erin Blanchfield.

title: Seahawks HC scoffs at notion Darnold won't start
content: Seahawks coach Mike Macdonald offered strong support of Sam Darnold after the quarterback struggled some during the first OTA that was open to reporters.

content: Manager Alex Cora is running out of excuses for the slumping Red Sox. He let his frustrations fly in the aftermath of Tuesday's 4-3 loss to the Angels, proclaiming that his team continues to repeat the same mistakes and isn't getting better.

content: Lance McCullers Jr. pitched six sparkling innings for his first win since 2022 as the Astros beat the Pirates 3-0 on Tuesday night.

content: Caitlin Clark's quad injury has had a ripple effect on the WNBA, including the betting interest in the Indiana Fever and the sport over the past week.

content: A representative of Real Madrid is in Buenos Aires to try to close the signing of River Plate star Franco Mastantuono, a source has told ESPN.

content: Manchester United legend Rio Ferdinand has told ESPN Brasil that being a pundit during the club's recent struggles has made him a meme on social media.

content: Barcelona face further punishments for breaches of UEFA's financial fair play (FFP) regulations, but club sources are hopeful they will avoid any severe sanctions from the governing body.

content: Florian Wirtz has denied reports that he wants the No. 10 shirt if he joins Liverpool this summer, in the Bayer Leverkusen star's strongest hint yet that a move to Anfield is progressing.

title: Sources: Chelsea keen on Maignan but balk at fee
content: Chelsea are exploring a deal to sign AC Milan goalkeeper Mike Maignan but the two clubs are a long way apart in their valuations, sources have told ESPN.

title: Gavi doubles down on critics: 'They have no idea'
content: Barcelona midfielder Gavi has doubled down on his claim that his critics have "f------ no idea" how good he is, saying people hate him for his style of play.

content: Champions Leagues, World Cups, Ballons d'Or ... get ready for PSG's DÃ©sirÃ© DouÃ© and Barcelona's Lamine Yamal to become this generation's Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo.

content: Here's everything you need to know about Season 33 of TUF. From how to watch, the coaches involved and the fighters competing for a UFC contract.

content: The UFC bantamweight champion will try to take Sean O'Malley to the mat at UFC 316. What he does from there will determine if he keeps the belt.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Charlo returns, Plant down four spots at super middleweight
content: Jermell Charlo's victory brings him back to the top 10 at 168 pounds, but where does he land? Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: 8 Snakes Rescued From UP House 2 Days After Villagers Kill 52 Serpents
content: Two days after the residents of Samouli village in Meerut district killed 52 snakes that crawled out of the courtyard of a farmer's house, forest officials rescued eight snakes from the same house, officials said.

title: Hyena Spotted Near Madhya Pradesh Village Where 6 Died In Attack By Unidentified Animal
content: In the wake of death of six persons after being bitten by an unidentified animal in Barwani district recently, the forest department has intensified its search operation after local residents sighted a hyena in the area, officials said.

title: Chirag Paswan's Poll Message In Letter To Nitish Kumar On Bihar Rape-Murder
content: Union Minister and BJP ally Chirag Paswan has written to Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, also a BJP ally, on the Muzaffarpur rape-murder case, raising serious questions on the state's law and order situation and public health infrastructure.

title: IIT Delhi Student Found Dead At Hostel Room, Was Last Seen On Monday
content: A student has been found dead at his hostel room in IIT Delhi. The room was locked from the inside and there were no external injuries on his body..

title: Opinion: Opinion | Musk Is Out Of DOGE, But Not Without Doing What He Had To
content: Musk was the battering ram that cracked open Washington for the privateers from the Valley. That job is complete.

title: Hurun List 2025: Shraddha, Priyanka, Alia Top Celebrity Women Investors
content: The newly released Candere Hurun India Women Leaders List 2025 highlights 97 women driving change across corporate boardrooms, startups, and creative industries.

title: NDTV Ground Report: Key Facts About World's Tallest Rail Bridge In India
content: The world will see an engineering marvel in India on Friday when Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurates the world's tallest railway bridge over the River Chenab in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Another YouTuber, With Over A Million Subscribers, Arrested In Spying Case
content: Weeks after the arrest of a travel vlogger in an espionage case, another YouTuber has been arrested from Punjab for allegedly spying for Pakistan as Indian agencies crack down on those leaking sensitive information across the border.

title: 6 Agra Girls Drown In Yamuna, Were Making Reels On Phone
content: In a tragic incident, six young girls drowned in the Yamuna River in Agra on Tuesday afternoon while bathing to escape the blistering summer heat, officials said.

title: Medical Aspirant, 18, Shoots Self Dead In Madhya Pradesh After Poor Result: Cops
content: A medical aspirant reportedly took his own life upon realising that his exam marks were insufficient to secure admission. The tragic incident occurred in the Maharajpura police station area of Gwalior, Madhya Pradesh.

title: World War 2 Bombs Discovered In Germany's Cologne, Thousands Evacuated
content: Thousands of people were being evacuated from central Cologne in western Germany on Wednesday after three American bombs from World War II, each with impact fuses, were discovered during construction work on Monday in Deutz.

title: "Have So Much To Speak As A Tamil": Kamal Haasan Amid Kannada Language Row
content: Actor-politician Kamal Haasan on Wednesday said he has a lot to speak as a Tamil but refrained from making any immediate comment on his "Kannada was born out of Tamil" remark that triggered a massive controversy last week.

title: Opinion: Opinion | This One Is For The Ever-Loyal Virat Kohli
content: It takes a special kind of commitment and faith to continue to believe, to hope, despite season after season of heartbreak and the headlines screaming tales of the team being so close, yet so far.

title: "100 Dead Cats, Skin Peeled Off": Inside Japan Woman's House Of Horror
content: Around 100 dead cats were discovered at the squalid home of a woman in southwest Japan who belonged to an animal welfare group, a local official said

title: 19th Century Condom, With Erotic Image, On Display At Dutch Museum
content: It is neither a painting nor a sculpture. It's a 19th-century condom, made from a sheep's appendix and printed with an erotic image of a nun and three aroused clergymen, now on public display for the first time in Amsterdam.

title: Explained: What Are Rare Earths And Why Has China Stopped The Export
content: Two months after China suspended exports of seven critical rare earth metals and powerful magnets made from them, the ban is posing a serious threat to manufacturing plants in the United States and Europe.

title: Musk's Starlink To Get Licence Soon? What Jyotiraditya Scindia Told NDTV
content: Emphasising that satellite communications is of immense importance in India, Union Communications Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has indicated that the country is eager to welcome players like Elon Musk's Starlink.

title: Indonesian Couple Publicly Flogged 100 Times For Having Sex Outside Marriage
content: Indonesia banned sex outside of marriage in its latest criminal code in 2022 but that law will not come into force until next year. The region started using religious law after it was granted special autonomy in 2001.

title: In Indore Missing Couple Case, Cops Find Out How Husband Was Murdered
content: The Madhya Pradesh man, whose body was recovered from a deep gorge 11 days after he and his wife went missing during their trip to Meghalaya, was allegedly murdered with a machete, police officers said, as the crime sent shockwaves across the state.

title: Odds, post positions for the Belmont Stakes
content: Preakness winner Journalism and Kentucky Derby winner Sovereignty have the best odds in the eight-horse field for Saturday's Belmont Stakes.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye PSG striker Ramos
content: Manchester United could turn to Paris-Saint-Germain striker Goncalo Ramos after missing out on Ipswich Town's Liam Delap. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Is the future of soccer in new, chaotic tournaments fueled by viral moments and celebrities?
content: Alternative soccer tournaments driven by celebrities, viral moments and huge cash prizes are all the rage. Are they the future of the sport, too?

title: Census from March 2027: Caste enumeration to be part of exercise
content: The next nationwide census will begin on March 1, 2027, with Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh, and Uttarakhand starting earlier in October 2026. For the first time in over seven decades, the census will include caste enumeration to ensure transparency and national consistency.

title: 9 aircraft, radar sites: Details emerge of Pak's big losses during Op Sindoor
content: Operation Sindoor, India's retaliatory strikes following the Pahalgam terror attack, decimated significant Pakistani military assets, including fighter jets and missile systems. The Indian Air Force targeted key airbases using air-launched cruise missiles, prompting Pakistan to seek a ceasefire within four days. India dismissed Pakistan's claims of civilian casualties as propaganda, asserting strikes were limited to terror infrastructure.

title: Allahabad HC rebukes Rahul: Free speech has limits, Army can't be defamed
content: The Allahabad High Court has rebuked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi regarding his alleged derogatory remarks against the Indian Army, emphasizing that freedom of speech under Article 19(1)(a) is subject to reasonable restrictions and does not extend to defamatory statements.

title: War twist: Ukraineâ€™s drone used my open-source code, says shocked developer
content: ArduPilot, an open-source software initially created for hobbyist drones, has reportedly been used in a Ukrainian attack that destroyed a portion of Russia's strategic bomber fleet. The software's creators expressed surprise at its military application, as it was originally designed for peaceful purposes like search and rescue and autonomous vehicles.

title: '18 years for me, 11 for her': Virat Kohli's touching message for Anushka Sharma
content: Virat Kohli's raw emotion poured out as Royal Challengers Bengaluru clinched their first IPL title, defeating Punjab Kings. Overwhelmed, Kohli collapsed on the field before sharing a tearful embrace with his wife, Anushka Sharma. He expressed their shared journey and relief, highlighting Anushka's special connection to Bangalore, making the victory even more meaningful for them both.

title: Happy Eid-ul-Adha 2025: Eid Mubarak images, wishes, messages, quotes and more
content: Eid-ul-Adha 2025 approaches, a time for Muslims worldwide to celebrate the Festival of Sacrifice. People are seeking heartfelt images, wishes, messages, and quotes to share with loved ones on social media platforms. The festival emphasizes love, compassion, and togetherness, encouraging acts of kindness and generosity in remembrance of Prophet Ibrahim's devotion.

title: AI cyber fraud: Inside Delhiâ€™s â€˜telecaller trapâ€™; fraud kits, dummy a/cs powered racket
content: In Delhi, a sextortion gang led by Jahid allegedly used AI and social media to blackmail vulnerable individuals. Jayshree lured victims, while others impersonated police. Another call center, managed by Ujjawal Pandey and Gaurav Barua, offered fake loans, extracting fees before cutting contact. Telecallers like Akshita, Dimple, and Pinki, under Dilshad Ali, posed as loan representatives, deceiving customers.

title: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis: If I were a student right now, I would study ...
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis advises students to prioritize STEM subjects and embrace AI tools for future job market success. Speaking at SXSW London, he emphasized the importance of understanding mathematical and scientific fundamentals. Hassabis predicts AI will create valuable jobs for technically skilled individuals, urging students to gain hands-on experience with AI systems.

title: Trump visa curbs: 'Totally quiet,' Cong questions PM's silence
content: Congress has voiced concerns over the potential impact of Donald Trump's visa policies on Indian students in the US, noting that approximately 337,630 Indian students pursued higher education there in 2024. Jairam Ramesh criticised PM Modi and EAM Jaishankar for their silence on the matter, contrasting it with China's strong reaction to protect its students' interests.

title: Chenab bridge: PM Modi to inaugrate worldâ€™s highest railway arch bridge
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate the Chenab Bridge, the world's highest railway arch bridge, marking a significant step towards enhanced connectivity in the region. The Vande Bharat trains will traverse the bridge, reducing travel time between Katra and Srinagar to approximately three hours.

title: Honeymooner hacked to death in Meghalaya: What wifeâ€™s last call to mom-in-law hinted at
content: Indore honeymooner Raja Raghuvanshi was found murdered in a gorge near Weisawdong falls, Meghalaya, with evidence suggesting he was hacked to death with a machete. Police are investigating the crime, searching for his missing wife, Sonam, and the culprits, while the family demands a CBI probe and Army assistance.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai on his sleep goal: I try to...
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai revealed his approach to managing a demanding schedule, emphasizing the importance of sleep and aiming for six hours nightly. He acknowledges the tech industry's dynamic nature and his tendency to be a late-night person. Pichai starts his day with Techmeme, a tech news aggregator also favored by other tech executives.

title: Is WW3 near? Meet hypnotherapist Nicolas Aujula whose 2025 warning sparks fear
content: Amid global instability, psychic Nicolas Aujula's 2025 predictions are gaining traction, echoing Baba Vanga's mystique. Aujula foresees a potential World War III fueled by a lack of compassion, alongside natural disasters and political shifts. His past accuracy, including predictions of Trump's return and the rise of AI, lends credibility to his alarming visions.

title: Virat Kohli's curious IPL trophy peek; RCB star checks what's inside
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru won the Indian Premier League after 18 seasons. They defeated Punjab Kings in a thrilling final. Virat Kohli, an iconic player, expressed his joy. He dedicated the win to the fans and the team's resilience. Kohli also shared a heartfelt message on Instagram. He amassed 657 runs this season.

title: 'Parliamentophobia': TMC MP after Centre calls Monsoon Session
content: TMC leader Derek O'Brien accuses the Modi government of "Parliamentophobia" for allegedly avoiding parliamentary scrutiny. This jab follows the INDIA bloc's request for a special session to discuss Operation Sindoor. The opposition emphasizes the need for parliamentary debate on critical national security issues, while the government suggests addressing these concerns during the upcoming Monsoon session.

title: 10 hidden facts about Earth: Amazing truths that sound like sci-fi stories
content: Earth harbors incredible secrets, from remnants of a planet that formed the Moon residing deep within, to ancient auroras illuminating the skies. The planet's molten core influenced early human migration, while ancient crystals reveal water existed 4.3 billion years ago. Discoveries like a supernova's mark in the ocean and a sinking North America highlight Earth's dynamic and surprising history.

title: Hot topic: Shaquille Oâ€™Neal makes Travis Kelce dances to Taylor Swiftâ€™s song
content: NBA legend Shaquille Oâ€™Neal surprised everyone by revealing his love for Taylor Swift's song. He sang along to 'I Knew You Were Trouble' on the Kelce brothers' podcast. Travis Kelce also mentioned Taylor Swift regained ownership of her music. The Kelce brothers welcomed Shaquille Oâ€™Neal to their New Heights podcast. The episode is set to premiere on June 4, 2025.

title: SC quashes rape charges: Man refuses to marry woman over â€˜aggressive sexual natureâ€™
content: The Supreme Court has dismissed rape charges against a man, citing the woman's "aggressive sexual behaviour" and manipulative tendencies. Justices Nath and Mehta referenced social media chats where the woman, known as 'Muffin,' admitted to manipulation and targeting men for personal gain, including seeking a green card.

title: 'Really hard': LeBron Jamesâ€™ wife reveals how being a teen mom affected her
content: Savannah James, wife of LeBron James, recently shared her experiences with motherhood on the podcast 'Everybodyâ€™s Crazy,' revealing how it shaped her identity. She admitted struggling to find herself outside of being a mom, especially with her sons.

title: Anushka Sharma joins Virat Kohli for RCB's IPL victory celebrations; crowd goes crazy
content: After 18 seasons of anticipation, Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) clinched their first IPL title, defeating Punjab Kings in a thrilling final. Virat Kohli's emotional celebration with his wife, Anushka Sharma, captured the historic moment. The victory marked a significant milestone for the franchise and its loyal fanbase, rewarding their unwavering support over the years.

title: 'Vindictive nature': Imran Khan alleges Asim Munir targeted his wife
content: Imran Khan has accused Pakistan's army chief, General Asim Munir, of a personal vendetta against his wife, Bushra Bibi, stemming from Munir's removal as ISI chief. Khan alleges that Bibi's imprisonment and mistreatment are due to Munir's vindictive nature, further claiming she refused contact after his dismissal.

title: Weeks before attack, Colorado terror suspectâ€™s daughter praised US for giving her future
content: Just before Mohamed Soliman's alleged terror attack in Colorado, his daughter Habiba spoke of her American dream. Now, following the antisemitic attack in Boulder, both are in ICE custody facing deportation. Soliman is accused of throwing Molotov cocktails at a pro-Israeli hostage march, injuring twelve.

title: Watch: When 'spy' YouTubers Jyoti Malhotra and Jasbir Singh were together in Pakistan
content: Indian authorities are investigating YouTubers Jyoti Malhotra and Jasbir Singh for alleged espionage linked to Pakistani intelligence. Malhotra, known as "Travel with Jo," is accused of sharing sensitive information and maintaining contact with Pakistani officials via encrypted apps.

title: RCB fans celebrate IPL victory with Vijay Mallya posters in Bengaluru
content: After an 18-year wait, Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) finally secured their first IPL title, sparking wild celebrations in Bengaluru, where fans were seen holding posters of Vijay Mallya. RCB defeated Punjab Kings by six runs in a thrilling final at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. RCB posted 190/9, while PBKS fell short at 184/7.

title: 'Back to...': Kohliâ€™s heart warming message to Salt after RCBâ€™s IPL triumph
content: Phil Salt experienced a whirlwind 48 hours, contributing to Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory and becoming a father. Despite not scoring big in the final, his earlier impact and a crucial catch helped RCB secure the win against Punjab Kings. Virat Kohli celebrated Salt's dual success, highlighting his commitment to both cricket and family as he embraced fatherhood.

title: Canadaâ€™s bill will stem the rising number of int'l students seeking asylum
content: Canada's Strong Borders Act aims to bolster border security and curb fraudulent asylum claims, particularly from international students. The bill introduces stricter timelines for asylum applications and enhances information sharing between immigration authorities and other government bodies. These measures respond to rising migration pressures and seek to protect the integrity of Canada's immigration system amid increasing backlogs and policy changes.

title: RCB fan dies of heart attack during victory celebrations in Karnataka
content: Manjunath Irappa Kambar, a 28-year-old RCB supporter, tragically died of a heart attack while celebrating the team's IPL victory in Avaradi village. He had organized a large celebration, foregoing sleep and meals to ensure its success. Overwhelmed with joy after RCB's win, he collapsed while dancing, leaving behind his pregnant wife, daughter and grieving family.

title: 'Equally yours, biscotti': Virat Kohli shares IPL trophy with AB de Villiers
content: Royal Challengers Bangalore secured their first IPL title in Ahmedabad. They defeated Punjab Kings by 6 runs in a thrilling final. Virat Kohli dedicated the victory to AB de Villiers. Kohli shared an emotional moment with De Villiers after the win. Kohli acknowledged De Villiers' immense contribution to the franchise. RCB posted 190/9, and Hazlewood's final over sealed the victory.

title: Drunk dad kills 1-year-old daughter by banging her head on floor for crying
content: In Raigad's Pen taluka, Suresh Dore, a 40-year-old man from an Adivasi hamlet, was arrested for the murder of his one-year-old daughter. Irritated by her crying, Dore fatally injured her by banging her head on the floor.

title: 'Corruption within judiciary impacts public trust': CJI amid Yashwant Varma cash row
content: CJI BR Gavai has voiced concerns over corruption within the judiciary, emphasizing the threat it poses to public trust. His remarks follow allegations against Justice Yashwant Varma. Gavai defended the collegium system, stressing judicial independence. He also cautioned against judges accepting post-retirement positions, citing potential ethical concerns and erosion of public confidence in the judiciary's impartiality and integrity.

title: Bummer! RCB's open bus parade celebrations cancelled in Bengaluru; reason revealed
content: Despite the win over Punjab Kings in the IPL final to secure their maiden crown, Royal Challengers Bengaluru will not be allowed to parade their trophy in Bengaluru. A traffic advisory issued by Bengaluru Traffic Police has come as a downer to several fans that were keen to take part in celebrations.

title: How â€˜couldnâ€™t let goâ€™ led to DU studentâ€™s murder by boyfriend days before her 19th bday
content: Mehak Jain, a bright 19-year-old student, was murdered by her boyfriend, Arshkrit Singh, just days before her birthday. Singh, suspicious and controlling, harassed Jain, even stalking her Korean classes. He created fake social media profiles to monitor her interactions. On Sunday, an argument in a park escalated, leading Singh to attack Jain with petrol and a knife.

title: What is the 'toxic fungus'? Chinese researchers allegedly tried to smuggle into US
content: FBI has charged two Chinese researchers, Yunqing Jian and Zunyong Liu, for smuggling a dangerous fungus into America. The pathogen, Fusarium graminearum, is a potential agroterrorism agent. Jian and Liu allegedly planned to research it at the University of Michigan. This fungus can devastate crops and contaminate grains. US Attorney Gorgon highlights grave national security concerns.

title: NEET PG 2025: Entrance test not before this date of August? What NBEMS told SC
content: The National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences (NBEMS) has informed the Supreme Court that the NEET PG 2025 exam cannot be conducted before August 3 due to logistical challenges. This rescheduling follows the Supreme Court's order to conduct the exam in a single shift, addressing fairness concerns raised about the previous two-shift format. The court is reviewing NBEMS's proposal.

title: How RCB celebrated IPL 2025 title in the dressing room - Watch
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru secured their first IPL title after 18 years, defeating Punjab Kings in a thrilling final. Director of Cricket Mo Bobat delivered an emotional speech in the dressing room, praising Virat Kohli's dedication and the team's unity. He urged the team to savor the victory and aim for another title next year in Bengaluru, celebrating their hard-fought triumph.

title: Bangladesh revokes 'freedom fighter' status of Sheikh Mujibur Rahman, others
content: Bangladesh's interim government has clarified that Sheikh Mujibur Rahman's freedom fighter status remains unchanged despite amendments to the Jatiya Muktijoddha Council Act. The amendments redefine participants in the independence struggle, recognizing members of the Mujibnagar government as "associates of the Liberation War." This clarification follows recent controversies, including the removal of Rahman's photos from banknotes.

title: Espionage case: After Jyoti, another YouTuber arrested; travelled to Pak thrice
content: Punjab Police's SSOC has exposed a terror-linked espionage network allegedly backed by Pakistan. Jasbir Singh, a YouTuber, is accused of maintaining contact with PIOs suspected of working for Pakistani handlers, including a previously arrested spy and an expelled Pakistani official. Singh's travels to Pakistan and interactions with Pakistani officials are under investigation, with seized devices undergoing forensic analysis.

title: Toxic love kills: 3 young women murdered by possessive partners in Delhi
content: Recent murders of three young women in Delhi, Komal, Vijaylaxmi, and Mehek Jain, highlight the dangers of possessive relationships. Fueled by jealousy and control, the perpetrators allegedly monitored their girlfriends on social media, particularly Instagram. Experts attribute this violence to deep-seated insecurities, unrealistic expectations, and the normalization of toxic behaviors, further exacerbated by social media's influence.

title: Shoaib Ibrahim updates fans that Dipika Kakar's Liver Cancer surgery was successful
content: Dipika Kakar, beloved by fans, underwent surgery for a cancerous liver tumor after a challenging diagnosis. Her husband, Shoaib Ibrahim, shared the news, revealing the 14-hour procedure went well and she's now in the ICU, stable but in pain. He expressed gratitude for the outpouring of love and prayers during this difficult time.

title: 'You've made me wait 18 years': Virat Kohli pens an emotional message
content: The RCB No 18 poured his heart out on Instagram as he recalled what has been 18 years in pursuit of the IPL trophy. He dedicated the win to the loyal Bengaluru fans. The 36-year-old scored 43 in the final and led the charge for his side in what was a thrilling finish to a very competitive season.

title: Expert picks for Thunder-Pacers
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder and Indiana Pacers are the last two teams left standing . the Pacers won the series in five games, four of which featured 30-plus point outings from NBA MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander . this is the Thunder's second finals appearance, and it would be their first as the Oklahoma city Thunder .

title: Jeanty tops among 20 rookies who should be selected in fantasy drafts
content: the focus is on redraft formats in 10-team PPR leagues . the top 20 rookies are ranked, along with the rounds they should be targeted . it's never too early to start planning for the fantasy season . we are less than 100 days from opening night in Philly .

title: Caglianone, Mauricio and other prospects on the rise
content: 1B Jac Caglianone is slated to make his MLB debut on Tuesday . he hit 15 home runs over 50 games and 228 plate appearances this season . there is a clear path for him to be a top-10 first baseman in fantasy .

title: Conn Smythe Watch: Connor McDavid for MVP of the playoffs -- win or lose?
content: the 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs are down to their final two teams . the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers meet for the second straight season . one of the players in this series is going to win the Conn Smythe as NHL postseason MVP .

title: Stanley Cup Final preview: Everything you need to know for Panthers-Oilers IIï»¿
content: a team appearing in the Stanley Cup Final in back-to-back years is something of a rarity . it's rarer still that both teams meet up again in consecutive Cup Finals . the two teams are back at it again starting with Game 1 on Wednesday .

title: Road to the MCWS: NCAA baseball tournament schedule, results
content: this is the first time the ACC has more super regional teams than the SEC since 2008 . UTSA and u.s. are making their first appearances in super regionals . the top two seeds are eliminated in the 2025 NCAA Division I baseball championship .

title: Why the Panthers will win the Stanley Cup (again)
